Hi everyone,

I were able to track down the source of the NPEs.
They were c=
aused by the AddRedirectFromRootServerToScope decideRule.
My decideRule cha=
in starts with a RejectAll, directly followed by the
AddRedirectFromRootSer=
verToScope rule.
For some reason my spider found links like "https:/" which=
 somehow
survived so far and caused headache as after a getHostbasename() t=
hey
obviously returned null - which isn't a good idea to call any methods
l=
ike .equals() upon. Surprisingly when via.getPath() returns a null
and we u=
se the .equals() method I get a fine stacktrace in
heritrix_out.log.
I'm no=
t sure if this is a "Won't Fix" as there is a catch-all
Exception handling =
in use in AddRedirectFromRootServerToScope - but
for me this issue was dist=
racting as I had no clue about the source of
my NPE until I further debuged=
 my spider.

Regards
  Olaf Freyer

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com,=
 "pandae667" <aaron667@...> wrote:
>
> Dear IA-Team,
> 
> I'm currently hav=
ing some problems with my heritrix installation.
> (based upon heritrix-1.1=
0.1 with some additional DecideRules that are
> currently NOT in use - thus=
 shouldn't be the source of my problem).
> I'm getting "java.lang.NullPoint=
erException" lines in my
> heritrix_out.log - with no stacktrace for it. Th=
is obviously makes it
> really tricky tracking down the source of those pro=
blems.
> 
> Does anyone have a clue how to locate the source of those?
> 
>=
 Regards
>   Olaf Freyer
